questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You are developing a Dynamics 365 app for a blank. The app must display information about loan accounts and the customers assigned to those items.
You need to model the relationships between objects used by the app.
Solution: Generate entity diagrams by using the metadata diagram tool.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content: A bit misleading in a sense that you can only use MetaData Diagram tool once you have already created the entities and the relationship has been configured. If the entities have not been created in Dynamics and the relationships have not been configured, then you won't be able to generate any diagram.

comments.content: The question mentioned that " ... objects used by the app". Means the objects are already in the app :)

discussion.content: in exam
Was in my exam, I was so lucky to see this question here with the comments below so I could answer. The answer is Yes
metadata diagram tools is to generate the ER diagram but not to build the ER, so the solution is not to model the relationship of entities. My answer is NO.

I believe the question regards on wether you can or cannot meet the requirement with the proposed solution in whatever condition it runs.
The answer is A.

Answer is YES

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/developer/use-metadata-generate-entity-diagrams

The answer is true: 
https://github.com/microsoft/PowerApps-Samples/tree/master/cds/GenerateEntityDiagram
What is the correct answer? I canÂ´t find Metadata Diagramm Tool in the SDK 9.0.
In Exam
The 'Metadata Diagram Tool' only exists in the 8.x SDK files. Since this is a 9.x test, it's a bit misleading.

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You are a Dynamics 365 for Customer Service administrator for Contoso, Ltd. A user named Elizabeth Rice signs in to Dynamics 365 by using the following sign in name: Elisabeth.Rice@contoso.com.
After marriage, Elisabeth changes her legal name to Elisabeth Mueller.
You need to update the sign in name for the user without losing any application history.
Solution: Ask the Microsoft 365 administrator to sign in to the admin portal and change the user name.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Correct Answer: A.
User first and last name are managed through the O365 portal
I think Yes should be the correct answer because you cannot update the sign in name. Can somebody explain why the answer is No?

comments.content:
The question is without losing Application history, Yes the system will allow changing the user name but when the user logged in with the new user name, the history will be lost. 
So its B

discussion.content:
correct - A, yes

in exam
Answer should be Yes. We can change the username from office 365 Admin portal

No. you need to be a global admin to make changes. Read the instructions.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/add-users/change-a-user-name-and-email-address?view=o365-worldwide

comments.content: They don't say what type of role this Microsoft 365 administrator has... Whether Global admin or something else..

discussion.content: user's information is managed by Office 365. To edit this information visit the User Administration section
Can someone please confirm if changing the username in the O365 admin center ONLY without the AD change as well that the application history for the user will not be lost?
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/930853/how-to-change-the-user-name-and-the-logon-name-for-a-user-record-in-mi

Its YES
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/add-users/change-a-user-name-and-email-address?view=o365-worldwide

comments.content:
Documentation says: 'You must be a global admin to do these steps.'
IMO: NO

discussion.content:
If Microsoft 365 Administrator is equal than Office 365 Global Admin, correct answer is YES but if Microsoft 365 Administrator is a user with System Administrator in Dynamics 365 or if Microsoft 365 Administrator is a Customized Administrator in Office Portal, the correct answer is NO
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/admin/add-users/change-a-user-name-and-email-address?view=o365-worldwide
Should ask a Office 365 global admin, not system administrator in Dynamics. Hence the No answer is correct.

comments.content: The solution says 'ask the Microsoft 365 administrator', not the system admin..
The USERNAME and SIGNIN NAME are the same things!

discussion.content:
The answer is A: Yes
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/office365/admin/add-users/change-a-user-name-and-email-address?view=o365-worldwide

comments.content:
Did you change the display name in the contact info within the admin center? because are different fields.
I tried all this on a trial enviroment, within Dynamics the username field is locked, you can only change it from the admin center. The display name you can change it either from the admin center and dynamics. If you do it from the admin center it would replicate in dynamics, but not viceversa.

The answer provided in the beggining is correct
I have done it as you said, made a log out, a hard reset of the cache and still have this:

https://1drv.ms/u/s!ArnMeJshgn4ftB3li8GQJdbRvLmc?e=BF6yWf

discussion.content: From Admin center you may change contact information, after log out and login dynamics you will see the change

Yes is the correct answer
I have tried on my dynamics 365 trial instance, Yes is the correct answer, 
I can change by clicking on Manage Username button and change contact information like forst name and last name by clicking on Manage Contact Information button. 

I have tried to change the username from Dynamics 365 -> Settings ->Security, 
The username field is locked out.
Only Global Administrator O365 can change username, in System Administrator of Dynamics 365 can't change in dynamics itself.
This is an In Exam question

I just tried it in the Admin Center. The thing is changing only the username will not work. The Last Name in the contact information of the user profile also needs to be changed. You click on the user and then click on the Manage Contact Information to update the last name. So in that case I would say NO is the correct answer.

comments.content:
The ask is only "You need to update the sign in name for the user without losing any application history."
which is possible from Microsoft 365 Admin portal
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/add-users/change-a-user-name-and-email-address?view=o365-worldwide

discussion.content: Just checked in the admin portal, the admin can change the user name to elisabeth.mueller@contoso.com. Answer is YES
USERNAME and LOGON name both must be changed so answer is no.
you can't change user name on the user record in 365 settings - Security - User. Therefor it must be Yes.
the answer is yes

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You need to create a system chart for the Account entity.
The chart must display a count of accounts grouped by owner and then display the accounts by Address 1: State/Province for each owner. You begin to configure chart options as shown in the image below.
//IMG//

How should you complete the configuration? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point. The chart must display a count of accounts grouped by owner, and then display the accounts by State/Province for each owner.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
the answers: account
count all
owner
address1

comments.content: I don't think there is any difference between the Horizontal Axis fields, so it can be Owner, Address1 or Address1, Owner

If you group by Owner then Address 1: State/Province the initial grouping will show Owners with bars showing the count of each State/Province. If you group by Address 1: State/Province first then the initial grouping will show State/Provinces with a bar showing the count for each Owner.
The answer is: Count: All, Owner, Address 1: State/Province

I mistakenly left out the first part (Account):
Account, Count: All, Owner, Address 1: State/Province
The result of this, what I believe is the correct answer is -> https://1drv.ms/u/s!Ajlw_u-9iVJohwiZBSYd5KjDCKTq?e=vzFGZx

discussion.content:
Agreed with mgharably
the answers: 
account
count all
owner
address1

Agreed with Fahad.
Account, Count All, Owner, Address: State/Province
Answer provided in the chart name field: "Account by Owner and Address 1: State/Province". :)

points to note : 
1.we can't do sum operation on account column so answer is countall on aggregate
2.we need to find out the from how many different provinces case records owned by each user. so first we need to have first Horinontal axis field as owner , then address 1
Given the choices, answer posted by mgharably seems correct. However, just wondering if selecting address 1 state/prov here would really display the state/prov for each owner or the account?

comments.content: No need to wonder, you can go and try yourself :) It's grouping.

For the Account. Getting the Owner's State/Province would be tougher. You would probably need a new custom field on the Account entity, which you keep up to date via a workflow (or via calculated field format) whenever the owner changes or the owner's state/prov changes, and then you could reference it in the Categories.

discussion.content: "Count:All" does even exist as an option ?

comments.content: Yes it does, on the Legend (series). Please check again.
Sum doesn't exist.. Count all does..

discussion.content: shouldnt it be sum of owner?

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You are a Dynamics 365 for Customer Service system administrator.
You enable the Quick Find view to look up First Name, Last Name, Email, and City on the Contact entity.
You need to identify where the Quick Find search will be used.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

comments.content:
Are there three locations?
The magnifier glass, funnel and the search field in the contact list?
Yes. Both searches will return results based on Quick Find View. I have tested it. We have to click both!
The reveal solution button does show both the fields highlighted if you observe correctly.. ;)

Based on the question "You need to identify where the Quick Find search will be used", which means, which search utility will rely on adding the fields to the Quick Find View search fields.

Global search on a field is enabled when you set the field as "Searchable" in the field configuration. So, if field is not searchable, and you add it to the Quick find view, the local search will find the record corresponding to it, which using the Global search will not find it.

discussion.content: If I am understanding this correctly, it seems that, to specify an answer for this question, you need to click on a "hot area" of the form to highlight it. The Reveal Solution button is showing one field highlighted - the Quick Search field for the entity. However, the Global Search field in the top navigation bar is an additional place where the Quick Find Search would be used. So to answer that question, I would click to highlight both the Quick Search field and the Global Search field.

comments.content: Thank you for clarifying! <3

discussion.content: Was in my exam, you can select 2 options only. I selected the Quick search and the Global search
in exam
https://crmbook.powerobjects.com/basics/searching-and-navigation/searching-crm/search-capabilities/

1. Set the Delimeter setting
2. Select the data map
3. Confirm and address issues with the field mapping
4. Select the appropiate setting Allow Duplicates property

comments.content: There can still be data mapping issues with the particular file being imported, even when a predefined data map is used. Menik's post is correct
Can not address data map issues since a predefined data map is being used.

discussion.content:
This is not correct, you do not specify the number of records anywhere.
Data duplicates yes/no is the last step and before that you address issues with data mapping
why is this question different from the official practice exam that Microsoft offers?

Correct order is : 1. Set the Delimeter Settings
2. Select the appropriate setting Allow duplicates property
3. Select the data map
4. Confirm and address issues with the field mapping
Was in my exam. @Menik has the correct answer which helped. See below

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You are a Dynamics 365 for Customer Service system administrator. You have a data file that contains a list of accounts which must be important into the system.
You need to import the accounts by using the Import Data wizard.
Which four actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//
